title: Financial investment professional
overviewOfRole: Provide investment-related financial services to stakeholders specific to investment banking, investment management, or investment operations

knowledges.detail: The structure of the Financial Services industry, its sectors and the role of specific organisations.
Organisational functions in financial services and their interrelation with the wider business.
External factors that impact on Financial Services, organisations, functions and roles.
Organisational culture and values including professional standards.
Principles and purpose of  legal and regulatory frameworks and ethics in financial services organisations activities.
Principles and purpose of risk and governance frameworks both external and internal to organisations.
Principles and procedures for financial investment services activities and the implications of non-compliance.
Features and principles of financial investment products and services.
Approaches to gathering and understanding stakeholder or customer needs and relevant financial service requirements.
Principles of communication including the identification and selection of optimal channels, written and verbal techniques and use of language appropriate to stakeholder need.
Approaches to delivery of fair customer outcomes across the organisation in a financial investment services setting.
Principles of systems, tools and processes used in financial investment services.

Approaches to working safely and securely with digital technology for example, modelling tools, work management systems, Artificial Intelligence and collaborative tools. EXETER - Approaches to FinTech and technological innovation in financial services and products. QMUL Asset Pricing & Financial Modelling including the principles of modelling and pricing financial assets ranging from the determinants of equity and fixed income assets to the valuation of derivatives; the accounting and mathematical techniques used to value firms.
Principles of legal, professional, and ethical frameworks including regulations regarding money laundering, market abuse, fraud and criminal finance.
Approaches to data analytics using digital technology to visualise findings from the analysis of financial and non-financial data from internal and external sources.
Approaches to work flow management, time management and prioritisation to meet deadlines.
Principles of project management.
Principles of sustainability in financial services including Environmental Social and Governance (ESG)
Approaches to teamworking and collaboration.
Principles of leadership for example in subject matter, client relationships or teams.
Principles of equity, diversity and inclusion and their impact on financial investment service delivery.
Fundamental principles of understanding and interpreting financial statements and accounts.
Principles of risk management in financial investment services.
Business economics including core economic principles of both microeconomics and macroeconomics that influence financial asset prices and financial decision making.
Features and principles of equity, alternative and fixed income markets.
Principles of reporting and accounting for investment banking transactions.
Principles of markets for "sell side" including primary and secondary markets and market structures for investment banking.
Quantitative methods, financial maths and statistics for investment management.
Investment and operational risk and minimising strategies for investment management.
Principles of markets for "buy side" including market trends and long-term structural trends that may impact valuations for investment management.
Investment operations processes and principles.
Principles of investment operations controls.
Principles of investment operational risk and control.
Sector specific market practices and their impact on investment operations.

behaviours.detail: Ethical, act with integrity in line with organisational values.  Maintains appropriate confidentiality at all times.
Flexible to changing work priorities and patterns, and the changing needs of the organisation.
Self-motivated and determined in their approach to their role. Deals with difficult situations positively, with resilience and tenacity. Stays positive under pressure and completes the task.
Creative, innovative and enterprising when seeking solutions to organisational needs within relevant boundaries such as ethical considerations, risks and financial services regulations.
Thorough and accurate. Takes ownership for the quality of outputs, recognises and resolves errors.
Leads and acts as a role model, supports others in their development and helps foster a culture aligned with organisational values.
Team player, aware of their role within the team, and the impact of their team within the organisation.
Supportive of colleagues and collaborative with stakeholders to deliver organisational objectives.

skills.detail: Build ethically sound and trusted relationships with internal or external clients or customers to form enduring partnerships.
Identify stakeholder needs and relevant financial services requirements through collaborative engagement.
Assess and analyse stakeholder needs to identify risks and benefits to options for resolution.
Provide flexible and innovative solutions to stakeholders to support their objectives.
Use financial investment services systems and processes in compliance with organisational policies and procedures.
Deliver challenging individual performance measures in line with organisation policy, values, standards and regulatory requirements.
Identify, assess and communicate financial investment risks to stakeholders following organisational process and procedure to address the risks.
Contribute to the delivery of financial investment services projects.
Contribute to the development of strategic and operational financial investment services plans.
Manage and report on progress of specified elements of financial investment services strategic plans in their area of responsibility.
Plan and organise workloads, prioritise and manage time to meet Key Performance Indicators or deadlines.
Gather and evaluate financial investment information, consider a range of perspectives and draw sustainable, evidence based conclusions.
Make sustainable financial investment services decisions using a structured approach.
Communicate with stakeholders and customers, including question and listen actively to discover, explore and understand needs and adapt engagement style to ensure mutual understanding.
Use tailored language in communication through a range of channels to communicate financial investment information to technical and non-technical audience as appropriate.
Engage and network with stakeholders, including senior management, to build positive working relationships and deliver organisational objectives.
Identify opportunities to drive higher performance and improve financial investment delivery, including sharing, and looking beyond the team for best practice.
Contribute to development of specific financial investment services changes through to implementation, this may include through wider projects.
Keep up to date with relevant legal, regulatory, commercial and sectoral changes, and alert others to the impacts.
build financial models, analyse data, methods used and outputs generated and document the work (including maintaining an audit trail)
interpret the accounts and financial statements of companies and financial institutions.
Seek and reflect upon feedback on personal performance and act upon it to develop and improve.
apply statistical and other techniques to analyse business problems and the risk they involve and present plausible solutions for consideration.
undertake complex financial modelling and research and analysis using appropriate tools
use trading and risk management tools, under supervision.
deliver technical advice to stakeholders and implement solutions.
undertake data analysis, research and reporting
deliver complex financial or asset modelling and valuation or pricing techniques using appropriate tools to form solutions and recommendations
generate qualitative and quantitative insights on financial services products, activities or objectives.
support development, and on-going management of stakeholder solutions, investment strategies and portfolios.
manage or influence others to deliver customer service in line with organisational expectations and standards in a financial service regulated environment.
undertake team coaching to improve performance of financial investment operations
Manage financial investment operations performance and resourcing.
Undertake budgetary planning.
deliver investment operations projects and control framework execution.

englishAndMathsQualifications: <p>English and maths qualifications must be completed in line with the <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.gov.uk/guidance/apprenticeship-funding-rules" target="_blank">apprenticeship funding rules</a>.</p>
reviewDetails: this apprenticeship will be reviewed in accordance with our change request policy.
clusterDescription: Provide high quality advice and support to internal and external clients across a full range of financial instruments and services using specialist knowledge of instruments and services supported and areas of the business worked in

duties.dutyDetail: Identify stakeholder investment needs and risk appetite to enable the best service to be provided such as banking solutions, investment management strategies or trading opportunities.

Use specialised financial acumen relevant to the investment team to provide flexible and innovative financial investment solutions for stakeholders such as clients, customers, internal colleagues or external bodies.
Assess and monitor the impact of investment services solutions for stakeholders being accountable for the outcomes of any guidance or recommendations given.

Collaborate with internal and, or, external stakeholders, subject matter experts and specialists within the investment services sector in order to build strong working relations to drive up performance and quality of service.
Provide expertise and support to internal and, or, external stakeholders to meet organisational service requirements and those of the wider financial services regulatory landscape.

Select, gather, evaluate and analyse financial qualitative and quantitative data appropriate to stakeholder needs such as feedback reports, portfolio and product performance metrics, cost reduction  or cost avoidance options, efficiency gains opportunities, client or product pricing or revenue generation.
Deliver investment services activities against individual and team performance measures such as revenue generation, efficiency savings or return on capital targets.
Deliver investment services activities within regulatory and compliance requirements.
Engage with stakeholders to network across the organisation to help embed a cohesive culture.

Collaborate with senior team members such as high value stakeholder leads or subject matter experts to deliver investment activities such as financial product recommendations or analysis, client or asset pricing, client or firm profitability analysis, financial or asset modelling

Communicate complex investment and financial information to stakeholders to ensure mutual understanding of opportunities, risks and mitigations such as changes to trade flows, pricing, payments, regulatory changes and their impacts on investments and stakeholders.
Plan and undertake continuous professional development within the Investment sector by maintaining current sectorial knowledge.
Contribute to identifying and rectifying areas for improvement in investment activities within the organisation.

Support clients with account planning and financial advice to aid the implementation of financial and investment solutions that meet their needs and risk appetite such as pitch books and the delivery of investment pitches to stakeholders.
Use financial modelling and apply risk management tools to support stakeholder investment decision making
use market data to develop, research and contribute to the creation of strategic materials for teams and clients.
Prepare and assist in preparation for stakeholder interactions for example, gaining new clients, reviewing investment portfolios and handling complaints.

Provide ongoing management and support for client solutions and investment strategies for example,  overseeing the performance of existing investments, monitoring key metrics, and implementing value-creation initiatives to optimize returns, real-time monitoring of trading activity and risk management of stakeholder liabilities to produce data and statistics to inform decision making on investments.

Research, analyse and suggest options for investment strategies for stakeholder needs for example pricing activities in real time, conducting market analysis, ensuring profit and loss is recorded accurately, daily risk delivery or accurate recording of expenditure.
Assist stakeholders with administrative duties such as uploading, recording, and executing trades.
Manage the administration of Investment operations activities to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and meet efficiency expectations.

Contribute to ensuring that regulatory, compliance and commercial changes are rapidly and appropriately combined in live investment operation processes and procedures to ensure effective functioning of the organisation.

Carry out stress tests or health checks on investment services processes and procedures to ensure that commercial outcomes are compliant and viable for example, reconciliations, oversight of control frameworks performance and arising operational risks are identified.
Contribute to ensuring that the delivery of investment customer service outcomes to stakeholders is maintained and improved in line with organisational expectations and standards.
